notes.text:
An update for jenkins-2-plugins is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Jenkins is a continuous integration server that monitors executions of repeated jobs, such as building a software project or jobs run by cron.

Security Fix(es):

* jenkins-plugin-script-security: Sandbox bypass through type casts in Script Security Plugin (CVE-2019-10355)
* jenkins-plugin-script-security: Sandbox bypass through method pointer expressions in Script Security Plugin (CVE-2019-10356)
* jenkins-plugin-workflow-cps-global-lib: Missing permission check in Pipeline: Shared Groovy Libraries Plugin (CVE-2019-10357)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1 jenkins-2-plugins security update

full_product_name.name: jenkins-2-plugins-0:4.1.1567707934-1.el7.noarch as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1
jenkins-2-plugins-0:4.1.1567707934-1.el7.src as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1

notes.text: A flaw was found in Jenkins Script Security plugin. Sandbox protection could be circumvented by casting crafted objects to other types allowing an attacker to specify sandboxed scripts to invoke constructors that weren't previously whitelisted. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins-plugin-script-security: Sandbox bypass through type casts in Script Security Plugin
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins-plugin-script-security: Sandbox bypass through type casts in Script Security Plugin

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Jenkins Script Security plugin. Sandbox protection could be circumvented through crafted subexpressions used as arguments to method pointer expressions.  This allows attackers the ability to specify sandboxed scripts to execute arbitrary code in the context of the Jenkins master JVM. The highest threats from this vulnerability are to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins-plugin-script-security: Sandbox bypass through method pointer expressions in Script Security Plugin
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: A missing permission check in Jenkins Pipeline: Shared Groovy Libraries Plugin 2.14 and earlier allowed users with Overall/Read access to obtain limited information about the content of SCM repositories referenced by global libraries.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins-plugin-workflow-cps-global-lib: Missing permission check in Pipeline: Shared Groovy Libraries Plugin
notes.title: Vulnerability summary
